column4: how do I find out what compiler my kernel was compiled with ?
why do you need to know anyway?
I've been trying to run a script, it says my kernel and current compilers are mismatched,
even though they're both 4.4 i think
what script?  it may be that the kernel headers you compiler are using do not match the kernel
its qc-messenger, a script ot install drivers for my quickcam, webcam
how do I check to make sure my headers are matching ?
i'm not entirely sure tbh....have you tried the hardware updater of the preferences or administration menu?
my camera is one that isn't supported out of the box
only supported by that qc-messenger driver, and I Can't compile it
yes, but sometimes it will ask you if you want to install non-open source drivers....worth a try if you haven't already
it doesnt....nothing shows up for webcams
hmm, i'm not really sure then...but I suspect that it's not a problem with ubuntu if you have a standard distro....I would expect it to work out of the box tbh
you could try downloading kernel sources...if not already installed...but i'm clutching at straws here really
yeah i know, my camera is actually turned on, but i can't get it working at all
I have the kernel sources already installed, I always have those on hand

i would think then that it's probably the driver / source you have isn't ubuntu friendly.  maybe search for a different version, or if that fails, you're probably going to end up hacking about with the scripts yourself...but again, i'm really guessing here
I looked everywhere to get this webcam working, since its a 08f5, its pretty rare and often rarely supported, what a pain :(
